Description: Textile; veil; salmon coloured silk (a); open weave, green selvedges, finished at both ends with a rolled hem. Red tapes (b) sewn to the upper corners. Braid with fringes (c) sewn to lower edge. (a) salmon coloured silk simple tabby Warp: Z- and S-twist, ca 35 ends/cm Weft: Z-twist, ca 18 picks/cm Edges: two plain selvedges, two cut and sewn edges Swing: dark pink silk sewing thread for rolled hem and overcasting attaching (b) and (c). (b) two lengths of red silk tapes, both broken and re-joined by knotting. Warp: silk, no visible twist, ca 9 (?) ends in 4mm Weft: none Swing: dark pink silk sewing thread for rolled hem and overcasting attaching (b) and (c). (c) narrow silk braid, pale blue border, centre with zigzags in cream and red; long blue knotted fringe added on one side; added fringe of bundles of silk threads, slight Z-twist, threaded through side of braid and knotted; warp-faced 2:2 chevron twill, knotting. Warp: Z-twist S-ply silk, ca 24 ends in 1.2cm Weft: Z-twist S-ply silk, ca 21 picks/cm Edges: two selvedges, two cut ends Swing: dark pink silk sewing thread for rolled hem and overcasting attaching (b) and (c).
Curator's comments: History of use: probably would have tied around head, with tapes, above nose H. Granger-Taylor, 9/11/1989
Condition: (a) poor - but colour good (b) and (c) fair - braid and fringe in good condition conservation: date unknown, stuck down to a sticky net
